name: Socalled
description: '''Joshua Dolgin''' (born December 28, 1976), better known by his stage name '''Socalled''', is a Canadian rapper and record producer, known for his eclectic mix of [[hip hop]], [[klezmer]], and other styles such as [[drum & bass]] and [[folk music]]. A pianist and [[accordion]] player, he has taught the latter at Klezfest London, where he has also run workshops in "hiphopkele". He has played with [[clarinetist]] [[David Krakauer (musician)|David Krakauer]]'s Klezmer Madness!, [[Michael Winograd]] and has also worked with artists such as rappers [[C-Rayz Walz]], [[Chilly Gonzales]], [[funk]] trombonist [[Fred Wesley]], and [[Sophie Solomon]]. Dolgin has [[History of the Jews in Ukraine|Ukrainian]], [[History of the Jews in Romania|Romanian]] and [[History of the Jews in Russia|Russian]] roots.
